snippet: The payments are not as common as they were in the 1980s, before a fascination with technology companies and potential capital gains led investors to view dividend payers as stodgy.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes proportion of both large and small American companies paying dividends has been rising since 1990s; says dividend for large companies has rebounded to record levels, but over past year, number of companies reducing or eliminating dividends has increased.
lead_paragraph: The payments are not as common as they were in the 1980s, before a fascination with technology companies and potential capital gains led investors to view dividend payers as stodgy.

headline.print_headline: Dividend Payments Are Making a Modest Comeback
headline.main: Dividend Payments Are Making a Modest Comeback
